page.title: 19MINSTERLEY WILDLIFE (2)
page.content: In our school grounds we have interesting wildlife.{Bats}live in the wooden slats of the school wall & {hedgehogs & rabbits}in the undergrowth near the stream.In Spring{hares sometimes come to the the field. In the copse are{celandines, wood {anemone, cuckoo pint, wild garlic, {wood sorrell & violets. Speedwell, {daisies, dandelions & plantain}grow in the grass. Common{newts}come every Spring to the school pond to breed. We find lots of insects in the Summer, like {froghoppers & hairy caterpillars.Under stones live{woodlice, ants, centipedes &{millipedes.
